title.narrative: WH1-HYGIENE IN COMMUNITIES & INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: By 2021, Children and families in the areas covered by the programme, especially girls, women and vulnerable people, are informed and educated about hygiene., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: People living in disadvantaged areas, especially women and children and people affected by emergencies, use safe, affordable sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Children and families in the areas covered by the programme, especially girls, women and vulnerable people, areinformed and educated about hygiene.

description.narrative: L’UNICEF a poursuivi à grande échelle la sensibilisation et la promotion des mesures barrières contre le COVID-19 en intégrant des messages de prévention dans le cadre de ses programmes plus généraux sur la promotion des bonnes pratiques d’hygiène. Ainsi, les activités de promotion de l&39;hygiène et du lavage des mains contre le COVID-19 ont atteint plus de de 974,700 personnes (dont 474,000 enfants). Des interventions en milieu scolaire ont permis de former plus de 42,281 écolières sur la gestion de l&39;hygiène menstruelle.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022
